Package io.elegie.luchess.pgn.impl.tokens

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    DelegateVisitor
    Intended for super classes to let their child classes decide which visitor method to call.
    Token
    A token represents a PGN entity, such as a move, a player or a chess event.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractToken
    Provides a basic implementation for a token, with a mechanism to manage successors.
    CaptureToken
    The capture is recognized when a 'x' char is matched.
    CastleToken
    The castle token recognizes a small or big castle.
    CheckToken
    The check token indicates that the opponent king is threatened.
    ClosingTagPairToken
    A tag pair ends with a right square bracket.
    ColumnToken
    Possible board columns, in chess, range from 'a' to 'h', always in lower case.
    Dot1Token
    The dot token is used to separate a move number from its corresponding value.
    Dot3Token
    A move may be split by various inserts, such as a comment, a NAG value, a variation.
    EndOfFileToken
    The end of file is reached when the reader returns -1, when its read() method is called.
    EndOfLineCommentToken
    The PGN format allows inline comments.
    FigurineToken
    This token matches a chess figurine, such as King, Queen, Bishop, Knight and Rook.
    MoveTextStartToken
    This token is used to mark the beginning of the moves of the game, right after the metadata section.
    MultiCharToken
    A token which matches any character from a predefined list.
    NAGToken
    A NAG Token refers to a Numeric Annotation Glyph, i.e. some entity which qualifies the move (for instance: "good move!").
    Number1Token
    In the specification, the digit '1' may be used to either describe a move number, or a game termination.
    NumberToken
    This token basically matches any number.
    OpeningTagPairToken
    An opening tag pair token starts the definition of a game metadata.
    PromotionToken
    This token indicates a pawn promotion, e.g.
    RangeToken
    Some Tokens of the specification - such as Strings, Multiline Comments, or Variations - are bounded by starting and ending characters.
    RootToken
    The root token serves as a start token for a tree, or subtree.
    RowToken
    Possible board rows, in chess, range from '1' to '8'.
    SetToken
    All tokens extending this class should have their value as a string, such as each char of the string comes from a given set (each char may be repeated).
    SingleCharToken
    This class defines a token matching exactly one char, which should be configured by subclasses in their constructor call.
    SpaceSeparatorToken
    This matches any sort of white space.
    StandardCommentToken
    Multiline comments, in the PGN format, are inserted within a pair of curly brackets.
    TagPairNameToken
    Tag pairs are key/value pairs representing a game metadata.
    TagPairValueToken
    Tag pairs are key/value pairs representing a game metadata.
    TerminationToken
    A Termination token marks the end of a game.
    TerminationWithNumber1Token
    The second part of a termination token, starting by the number 1.
    TerminationWithoutNumber1Token
    Termination tokens for black losing ("0-1") or the game being unfinished ("*").
    UnstructuredMoveToken
    A move can be quite complex to parse, as it includes definition of pieces, board coordinates, captures, promotions and checks.
    VariationToken
    A variation is a sequence of moves applicable at any point of the game.
